name: RetrievePortfolioMemberships
description:
Retrieve compact portfolio membership records for a portfolio.

Call this tool to obtain a list of portfolio membership records associated with a specific portfolio in Asana. Use it when you need to view or manage the members of a portfolio.

parameters.name: portfolio_identifier
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the portfolio required to fetch membership records.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the portfolio.

parameters.name: user_identifier
parameters.description: A string identifying a user. This can be 'me', an email, or the user's gid.

value_schema.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Number of portfolio memberships to return per page, between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: Offset token used for pagination to retrieve the next page of results. Use the token returned from a previous request.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: include_optional_fields
parameters.description: Specify a list of optional properties to include, using a comma-separated list.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true to receive a readable, formatted response. Use this primarily for debugging due to increased response size and time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.
